title: Safety warning after carbon monoxide poisoning on motor cruiser results in loss of 2 lives

body.content:
##Safety Bulletin 2/2016

[InlineAttachment:MAIBSafetyBulletin2-2016.pdf]

![InlineAttachment:SB2-16-LoveForLydia_Figure01_BoatAlongside-CanopyAsFound.jpg]

A video summarising the lessons identified by our investigation has also been produced:

[MAIB investigation for Cemfjord](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZnITXUVYzUY&feature=youtu.be)

###Summary

Safety warning issued following an accident on board the Doral 250 SE motor cruiser Love for Lydia at Wroxham on the Norfolk Broads between 6 and 9 June 2016. Two people and their dog died when they suffered carbon monoxide poisoning.

A full report will be published when the investigation is complete.

###Further information

Further advice on how to avoid carbon monoxide poisoning on boats, and more detail about carbon monoxide alarms has been produced by the [Boat Safety Scheme (BSS) and the Council of Gas Detection and Environmental Monitoring (CoGDEM)](http://www.boatsafetyscheme.org/stay-safe/carbon-monoxide-(co)).
